facts: Rival of the Roman/Byzantine Empire for over four centuries.
Major achievements in statecraft, architecture, and literature.
Zoroastrianism as state religion; complex court protocol.

rulers.name: Ardashir I
rulers.description: Founder; defeated the last Parthian king Artabanus IV.

rulers.name: Shapur I
rulers.description: Captured Roman Emperor Valerian; built Bishapur.

rulers.name: Shapur II (The Great)
rulers.description: Longest-reigning Sasanian; wars with Rome; internal reforms.

rulers.name: Ardashir II
rulers.description: Placed by nobles after Shapur II.

rulers.name: Bahram IV
rulers.description: Known as Kermanshah founder in tradition.

rulers.name: Bahram V (Gur)
rulers.description: Famed in Persian literature; hunt and romance tales.

rulers.name: Khosrow I (Anushiravan)
rulers.description: Golden age of Sasanian administration and culture.

rulers.name: Hormizd IV
rulers.description: Political tensions with nobility and clergy.

rulers.name: Khosrow II (Parviz)
rulers.description: Zenith then collapse during Byzantine wars.

rulers.name: Shahrbaraz
rulers.description: General who seized the throne briefly.

rulers.name: Yazdegerd III
rulers.description: Last Sasanian king; Arab conquests end the dynasty.
